title: Biden Weighs Nominating Former FDA Commissioner Robert Califf to Lead Agency Again
sub_head: The Food and Drug Administration has been without a permanent chief since President Biden took office
body:
WASHINGTON—President Biden is considering nominating former Food and Drug Administration Commissioner Robert Califf to lead the agency again, a person familiar with the process said.
The FDA has been without a permanent chief since Mr. Biden took office and continues to play a central role in the government’s response to the coronavirus pandemic. The agency has been overseeing key decisions such as the authorization of Covid-19 vaccines, booster shots and therapies, and at times has faced both internal dissent and public criticism over its regulatory process.
